    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void displayMessage​(PrivateConnectionMessage pck)
    Display on the client's console the private message received from a private connexion
    void doConnect()
    Performs the connect action on sc The convention is that both buffers are in write-mode before the call to doConnect and after the call
    void doRead()
    Performs the read action on sc The convention is that both buffers are in write-mode before the call to doRead and after the call
    void doWrite()
    Performs the write action on sc The convention is that both buffers are in write-mode before the call to doWrite and after the call
    long getId()
    Get the client's unique ID
    void processIn()
    Process the content of bbin The convention is that bbin is in write-mode before the call to process and after the call
    void processOut()
    Try to fill bbout from the message queue
    void queueMessage​(Frame msg)
    Add a message to the message queue, tries to fill bbOut and updateInterestOps
    void silentlyClose()  
    void updateInterestOps()
    Update the interestOps of the key looking only at values of the boolean closed and of both ByteBuffers.

    • updateInterestOps

      public void updateInterestOps()
      Update the interestOps of the key looking only at values of the boolean closed and of both ByteBuffers. The convention is that both buffers are in write-mode before the call to updateInterestOps and after the call. Also it is assumed that process has been be called just before updateInterestOps.
      Specified by:
      updateInterestOps in interface Context
